document_data.caption: Old City of Phlan, the walled portion of the city built atop Valjevo Isle (center left)
document_data.name: Old City
document_data.mainbody: The '''Old City''' of [[Phlan]], sometimes still referred to as "Old Phlan",{{Cite adventurers league/Reclamation of Phlan|51}}<ref group="note">While the designation of "Old Phlan" was used nearly exclusively to refer to a portion of the city during the 14{{th}} century [[DR]], it does appear a handful of times in the ''[[Reclamation of Phlan]]'' module. This appears to be a mix-up of the two similar names that describe partially overlapping region of [[Phlan]]. was the walled-off section of the city as it stood ''circa'' the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].{{Cite dungeon/170/Monument of the Ancients|60}}
document_data.Geography: The Old City encompassed the portion of Phlan built atop ''Valjevo Isle'', separated from the [[Nobles' Quarter]] and [[East Phlan]] by the [[Stojanow River]].{{Cite dungeon/170/Monument of the Ancients|52}} It comprised the two areas previously referred to throughout the 14{{th}} century as [[Old Phlan]] and [[Civilized Phlan]].{{Cite dungeon/170/Monument of the Ancients|53}}
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1480}}, Old Phlan had to be locked down due to the many refugees that flooded the city from outlying settlements north of the [[Dragonspine Mountains]].{{Cite dungeon/170/Monument of the Ancients|50}} Barbarians from [[the Ride]] sacked [[Whitehorn]], [[Verdigris]], and [[Ilinvur]], along with smaller communities across the region.{{Cite dungeon/170/Monument of the Ancients|49}}
document_data.Notable Locations:
{{Main|Phlan#Old City}}
The Old City of Phlan housed the majority of its long-established businesses, favorite haunts, and historical landmarks that had survived the city's numerous catastrophic events.
